instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: fin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
backlight output on connector and screen side burned, connector replaced
wire ran <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR> pin4 to pin 6 (pad missing from pad 4)
wire ran from <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> ball 5 to pin 1 <CAPACITOR>C7797</CAPACITOR> (no continuity between <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> and lcdbklt
0.858k ohms to ground at f7700, ppbus voltage 8.46
<CHIP>U7701</CHIP> replaced 
150mv on lcdbklt 
testing done without screen, tested not working with screen

threads.title: fin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Without screen there wil never be backlight voltage.....

threads.title: fin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: I know that, It tested the same with, if it helps voltage on l7701 pin1 is 0.2 volts and pin 2 is 170mv
